text: Somehow I got to this article by Fred Brooks: "The Computer Scientist as Toolsmith II" and found it really interesting, I decided to summarize some of its points here: <https://instadeq.com/blog/posts/computer-science-a-discipline-misnamed-fred-brooks/|Computer Science: A Discipline Misnamed (Fred Brooks)>

elements.text: Somehow I got to this article by Fred Brooks: "The Computer Scientist as Toolsmith II" and found it really interesting, I decided to summarize some of its points here:
Computer Science: A Discipline Misnamed (Fred Brooks)

text: TBH, I've never much liked this framing. There are, so far as I can tell, three very different things that get lumped together in our field: programming, software engineering, and computer science. Brooks is talking about software engineering here, and I agree with everything he's saying _in that context_, but there are many findings in theoretical computer science that are as primal as anything we know from any other branch of the sciences.

elements.text: TBH, I've never much liked this framing. There are, so far as I can tell, three very different things that get lumped together in our field: programming, software engineering, and computer science. Brooks is talking about software engineering here, and I agree with everything he's saying
, but there are many findings in theoretical computer science that are as primal as anything we know from any other branch of the sciences.

text: I agree with that, I think it made sense in the beginning to have everything under a single name since the boundaries were unclear, but I believe there's a part of CS that should "move" to the math side, a part that should become engineering and a part that should move to design.

elements.text: I agree with that, I think it made sense in the beginning to have everything under a single name since the boundaries were unclear, but I believe there's a part of CS that should "move" to the math side, a part that should become engineering and a part that should move to design.

text: another theoretical part should find a space in complex/emergent systems research

elements.text: another theoretical part should find a space in complex/emergent systems research

text: and we should try to keep al in close contact but don't expect one to be "above/better" than others
